name: The Westin Bonaventure Hotel & Suites

reviews.title: 1961 may have been a great year...
reviews.text: But it wasn't their best room. Granted we got a cheap rate through priceline (with tax for a Saturday night was right under $100) and that's about the most I would have paid. Parking is 25 per night and includes in/out privliges. The lobby is nice, but very lacking in ameneties for travelers. The lobby bar serves Starbucks, but the menu is very limited, there are six levels of shopping, but there were no brand name or recognizeable stores...mostly six levels of gift shops, or luggage stores. One level is fast food type shops, look to be all locally run (no franchises). The new workout room is nice and spacious. The room that we were in was directly next to the elevator in the blue tower, so when we had the lights on, you could see directly in. It was very quiet however, considering we were literally right next to it. Room was very small, with double beds (not exactly comfortable for three people who are all almost 6 feet tall. I did try to use my Starwood Preferred Guest card at check in for a room on the 26th level but was declined. The tip I had read on here may only work on a weekday or during a slow season. We made one visit to the Bonaventure Lounge on the 35th floor. It is a revolving lounge, it is very slow moving and subtle, but offers some beautiful downtown views. It is a large convention hotel, however outside of larger lines for food/beverages, it didn't feel as crowded as I'm sure it was. Valet parking was prompt and friendly.

reviews.title: No Sweet Sleeper Here!
reviews.text: I would go back for the central location and proximity to everything.
Booked a night at the Bonaventure so that we could be rested to see King Tut the next morning. It is a beautiful hotel that everyone has always raved about.
reviews.title: Favorite place in downtown LA

reviews.text: We requested and got a room w/ 2 beds. These beds were much smaller than a normal "double" bed. I had to sleep w/ one child and my wife with the other because of the size of the mattresses. It would have been almost impossible for 2 adults to fit side by side on these beds.
reviews.title: Wow! It was the best we visited so far
tattered and worn
reviews.text: If you book there, make sure you confirm the size of the bed before you pay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing vaule! $79.00 on Priceline.com got a room on the Starwood Preferred floor with an unristricted view of the city (26th floor, take the red elevator). View was breathtaking! Had a King size Heavenly bed which the Westin is famous for. The hotel truely is it's own little city complete with tons of shopping, dining, large pool and hang out area...They have a cool Vegas-esque style ultra lounge called Suede on the main floor and also a revolving restaurant on the 34th floor. Only negative about the hotel was the parking price (which is pretty expected in downtown LA or San Diego) and also that almost everything on the dining/shopping levels was closed fairly early on Sat. night. Overall great hotel, amazing view, and awesome location! Would stay again.
reviews.title: Great City View at the Bonaventure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a pretty good rate on Priceline, but sadly, not good enough. This hotel needs major renovating. We will not stay here again. The Omni is by far superior. Also, I read about the parking fee and knew ahead of time, unfortunately all the lots around the hotel were already full so we had no choice but to park at the hotel. $40 to park is ridiculous, especially when the room was only $85!!!
reviews.title: Needs Renovating!
Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: I have to say that I am amazed at some of the negative views on this hotel. I suppose it depends on what your expectations are. I think for the $85 a night I paid for the hotel through priceline, as many people have done, it far exceeds expectations. if you have a car like we did, just park it elsewhere. I didn't know about the trade centre, but we parked at the Mariott for $18 per night which is not bad for the middle of a city. The room was very clean. Yes it is a little dated, but very clean. We had 2 beds which were very comfy and a great view from downtown from the 15th floor and we were not by the elevators. We like the fact that there was an italian restaurant and a pub as part of the hotel for reasonable prices which we could go to easily as single young females. The pool is great as was the gym. In fact, it is one of the best hotel gyms I have been to for a long time. Downtown LA is probably not the best tourist destination but it is very easy to get from there to other parts of the city. Overall, excellent!
I just returned home from California. Thankfully, once I checked out of the Westin Bonaventure Hotel, my vacation took an upward turn and became very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Letter To Hotel Management...Ugh!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bonaventure hotel caused me nothing but grief! At check in I was told that there was no room available. Then a king-sized bed became available. After much insistence, my reserved 2-bedded room miraculously appeared. A few hours later, I found out that my roommate had been placed in a separate room. Please note, that upon my arrival, I was told she had not yet checked in! Now, I was told to move my belongings to her room on a lower floor; no assistance was offered.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: Stayed here in mid-April, and found most of the negative reviews here to be without merit. Had a very pleasant stayy. The hotel is what you would expect from a Westin. Good and prompt service. Well-appointed rooms and bathrooms. Staff were quite pleasant and helpful without being obtrusive. I agree that the cost of parking is steep ($25) but it's in line with other garages in the area. Contrary to some refviews, the buffet breakfast is $17 -- not $25 -- again not cheap, but in line with what you would find in most any similar hotel. The only legitimate complaint is the hideously overpriced restaurant (LA Prime) so have a drink in the bar -- for the view -- and then dine elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great and Interesting Hotel

reviews.text: Let me say I stay here everytime we goto a Laker game,and its one of my favorite hotels, first of all its a Starwood and all Starwoods allow pets, sometimes we bring our two small dogs, this is probably one of the best hotels in a suburban city for pets, they have great property & grass coverings in the back of the hotel, there is alot of space for them to run around in, and you can bring your pets into any of the 20 retail shopping stores inside if you want to shop with them ( kinda like 3rd st Santa Monica )
reviews.title: Excellent hotel regardless of bad reviews

reviews.text: As far as the negative reviews on here, these people dont know what to expect, so if its not all they thought then they write a bad review. if you ask me anyone is crazy to have any negativity on the property, staff, and inside rooms, orfacilities.
reviews.title: Miami Vice in downtown L.A.

reviews.text: First of all if you havent noticed it was built by a man who had beautiful vision and dream for a hotel, this is the most amazingly built hotel in California, its all glass outside, revolving resteraunt up top, and the hotel has cylindrical scenic elevators thoughout the hotel, and they are great views going up to 30 stories, a six story atrium, and yes the rooms are quite small, unless you get a mini suite which has two bathrooms. The standard rooms have the heavenly bed and great amenities, the windows are all floor to ceiling breathtaking views of the other skyscrapers rightoutside, and it seems like they are right in front of the window, very impressive to me!
reviews.title: Big disappointment

reviews.text: People can say the room is small, but they will never say its not nice, cause it is. Too bad the people who are writing these bad reviews on the Bonaventure dont appreciate what they are standing in, its the 10th most photographed building in the world.
reviews.title: A nice business hotel in the heart of LA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was nice. I took the FlyAway bus from LAX, walked from Union Station to the Hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: Better to go up 5th Street than 3rd or 4th because of the hill. (Angel's Flt is under repair).
reviews.title: Fantastic service - not much else.

reviews.text: The lobby's really nice, I liked the roof top bar. Service was good.
reviews.title: Close to the freeway!

reviews.text: The bed was great. Okay, the bathroom was small, but it was still a very cool hotel.
reviews.title: Piece of crap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone - and I mean everyone, from the car valet to the doormen to the bar attendants - is top notch in terms of friendly service. They excell at making you feel comfortable in what could be termed an un-friendly part of the city.
reviews.title: Nice hotel... Rooms a bit dated though!

likes.disliked: — Not much to do in the immediate location

reviews.text: We planned a last minute trip out to LA and decided to book the hotel through Hotwire. Hotwire has never done us wrong and gave us four star hotels in Century City the last time we used it. So, I assumed hotwire would do the same thing, but I was wrong!! Like many, we were excited to stay at a Westin but staying at this hotel was like staying at a 2-3 star hotel. First off, parking is horrible!!! We were not going to pay $47 to park it overnight so we parked at the World Trade Center for $9.90. Second, once we got to the room, we noticed how outdated and dirty it was. The bathtub was peeling and hair, that was noticeably not ours, was lying all over the place. And to top off that, they did a monthly fire alarm testing for 30 minutes in the morning!!!! This is by far the worst place I have ever stayed at and the best part was finally leaving the hotel.
reviews.title: Yuck yuck YUCK!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My suggestion, spend the extra $47 dollar elsewhere.. especially if it has free parking. I would never again stay at this place.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to Los Angeles to see a Dodgers game (even though we are not Dodgers fans, we are just into seeing old ballparks.) This hotel was the closest to the ballpark that had a favorable rating on Tripadvisor We were not disappointed. Sure the valet rates are out of sight, but we got a great rate on our room, the staff was superb, we ate at the LA Prime Saturday evening and the food was outstanding, we loved being able to walk over to the French Market in the Galleria for snacks and wine, the valet service was excellent, and the lobby bar was very nice with very friendly bartenders. When we checked out, a young couple with 4 kids were complaining to the management about stained carpet and said he had four more complaints. I did not stand around to here the other complaints, but I have to say I didn't view this as a "family hotel." If I would have had children with me, I would have opted for a Residence Inn or someplace with a suite. Oh, and the complaints about the different towers - the different elevators really cut down on the wait time for your elevator. Whoever thought up the concept for this hotel was thinking about the hotel client, and the layout makes A LOT of sense, contrary to others who complained about the layout.
reviews.title: Pretty hotel....pretty bad!

reviews.text: Ok, so the hotel is beautiful to look and and has glass elevators. But that's about it, any frequent Westin visitor will be disappointed with the dirty small outdated rooms, the thin walls (we could hear the person in the room beside us going to the bathroom) and the valet parking priced well above the nearby competition.
reviews.title: A City within a City

reviews.text: They did knock off some of the parking charges because of failing to meet Westin expectations, and they do plan a reno in the fall, but until then, I won't consider going back.
reviews.title: This place sucks. Avoid at all costs.
Great stay!!
reviews.text: The suites are lovely and spacious and clean. Ample large towels, ample pillows, plump and comfortable comforters on a fantastic bed. VERY nice sleeping. Loved the double shower head, too, true luxury. When we had a problem in the room, the staff was very quick to help and to fix whatever the problem was. We liked having the restaurants and shops close at hand. Rooms service dessert was *great*. The hotel is very large but I don't understand why people were getting lost in it, we found it easy to navigate. Very nice lobby. Parking was expensive, but other garages in the immediate area were the same price, and the valet service was fast and good.
The only negatives were: the pool was a little shabby and the windows weren't clean, but I guess that's going to be a problem in LA!
reviews.title: the smoking rooms are nasty

reviews.text: At checkin, I was given a smoking room even though I requested a non-smoking one. The clerk at check-in wouldn't do anything and insisted that their allocation of non-smoking rooms was full. Either the hotel has too few of their 1300 rooms designated non-smoking (as I have seen this problem in some of the other reviews also) or they didn't care about satisfying a customer using priceline to book the room. I hoped the room would be tolerable but it had a really nasty smell to it and housekeeping makes no effort to get rid of it. Other than that, it was an average 3* hotel room (not 4* as priceline rates it) with the heavenly bed and the view with floor to ceiling windows being the only memorable positive aspects. Also, I was able to avoid the high parking fee by finding a spot on the street so you may want to drive around for a little while to try your luck.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: Just got back from l.a and stayed at the westin it was great.The service was great was upgraded to suite on arrivial dont know if that is because iam a gold starwood member.Only problem was that the restaraunts close early from mon/wed great gym and great beds
reviews.title: Not bad a place to sleep

reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to LA with our 13 year old daughter the week of August 28th. I got a package deal on Expedia with air for this hotel. The hotel is downtown with easy access to highways and to the more popular areas of LA like Santa Monica, Hollywood, and other beach cities. You can take public transit but we had a car. We had a standard non smoking room on the 14 floor in the red tower with 2 double beds.
reviews.title: had it's plusses and minuses

reviews.text: I stayed here while working a show at the Convention Center. I have to admit I've got a thing for hotels with glass elevators that run along the outside of the building, and the Bonaventure is one of those places.
reviews.title: Large and likeable

reviews.text: This was a really convenient location and the staff was extremely polite and helpful. The valets in the lot were fast, it was easy to hail a taxi, the breakfast buffet was surprisingly fresh and good, and the place was easy for an out-of-towner like myself to find.
reviews.title: Nice, but hectic hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are standard Westin, with their really comfortable Heavenly bed and their odd double-headed Heavenly shower. The rooms had floor to ceiling windows with great city views.
reviews.title: A Mega Convention Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself has that late 70's-early 80's futuristic style going for it - which you will either love or hate. What surprised me though were the large number of vacant stores and restaurants within their indoor shopping center. It kinda gave me a weird feeling that you could hide out in one of the many hidden areas of their shopping center and not be found by anyone.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Great Stay
reviews.text: Anyway, I liked the Bonaventure and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

This hotel was very convenient to CA-110 and had no problems finding it. When we arrived late, I quickly checked in and did not use their $42 valet parking service. Instead I chose to park it myself across the street at the world trade center. The parking was only $9.90 with no in/out privileges if you arrive before 10 AM or after 4:30 PM and you could park for 24 hours until the regular rates kick in. This was fine with us since we only use the garage for over night parking. The hotel even has a walkway that connects the world trade center parking garage. Just take the elevator to the 1st floor and follow the sign to the Westin hotel, take the escalator to the 2nd floor and take the walkway to the hotel, which will get you to the sixth floor of the hotel. You will then need to go down a spiral staircase to the 5th floor to take the elevator to the room. It is inconvenient, but I am OK with a little inconvenience to save over $32 per night.
reviews.title: Stained and dirty carpet and oddly shaped rooms

likes.liked: — The many choices of eateries for the budget conscious travelers, which includes fast foods.
likes.disliked: — The room was small and stained and dirty carpets.

reviews.text: The hotel has 4 sections (blue, orange, yellow, red) where the rooms are located. All the section are connected, it is designed like a rotary. So, if you go up the wrong color elevator, just follow the signs to the center and go around until you see the color you want.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs in the Westin Bonaventure Downtown LA

reviews.text: Each section of the hotel is shape like a cylinder, which is probably the reason the rooms are shaped like slice of pizza. The rooms are small and shaped funny that in order to open the refrigerator, I have to push the chair to the desk all the way in or remove it to be able to use the refrigerator. The room that we were first assigned had a stains on the carpet and seems dirty. We had a connecting room to a family that was so noisy that we had to request another room. The carpet in the second room was also stained and dirty, but at least it was quiet. The room has the air vent about a foot above the headboard, which I did not like. The bathroom sink was situated far in the corner, which makes it hard for our family to use the sink being only 5 feet and under. The edge of the sink was about 6 inches away from the edge. The shower had 2 shower heads side by side. We were on the 19th floor and had a nice view of the city.
reviews.title: Be careful of the valet

reviews.text: There were lots of shops and restaurants from fast food to high price restaurants. There were about 11 fast food places like subway, seafood, pizza, hamburger, Korean BBQ, Chinese, and Starbucks. Restaurants include Chinese, Italian, Japanese, and steak
reviews.title: Seen better days

reviews.text: I am a regular Mon-Thurs business traveler to LA. I've been staying in the Westin Bonaventure Hotel in downtown LA since December 2007. It's a great business hotel and it has many conveniences. Unfortunately, I stayed two weeks ago in room 2958. (Yeah I have a good memory for numbers) It's one of the smaller suites on the top floor of the hotel (aside from the restaurant and rotating bar levels which are 30 and 31).
reviews.title: True Lies

aka: The Westin Bonaventure Hotel And Suites
description: This iconic LA symbol is found in the Financial District. We're also within walking distance of Los Angeles Convention Center plus entertainment venues such as Staples Center, Nokia Theatre, LA Live.
